Description: Floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup-skyphos or bowl; glazed black on interior and underside; impressed decoration on interior consisting of three concentric rows of rouletting with a palmette overlapping the inner two rows.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski compares the fragment with a cup-skyphos, Agora P 1095 (Sparkes, Agora XII no. 1047 ol. 59), dated 400BC - 375 BC. For the impressed design, see also Agora P 646 (Sparkles, Agora XII no. 805 pl. 58), a bowl dated 375 BC - 350 BC. Shape seems uncertain.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 46 no. D 4 pl. 18.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1786)
